events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 14th involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident as the incident involved a car collision with moderate damage reported.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to the case to ensure the customer receives timely assistance and guidance.
The customer was notified that their claim for the auto accident has been officially acknowledged and is under review.
Agent requested necessary documents including photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver's license to proceed.
The customer submitted all requested documents on time, including detailed photos and the official police accident report.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted witnesses to verify the accident details.
After thorough analysis, the investigation confirmed the customer was not at fault and damage assessment was finalized.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to the customer to cover repairs and associated costs for the damaged vehicle.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and appreciated the clear communication throughout the process.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement, enabling the next steps for compensation.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued and sent to the customerâ€™s bank account without delay.
With payment processed and confirmation received, the auto accident claim case was officially closed successfully.
All records related to the auto accident claim were archived securely for future reference and auditing purposes.
